trial_identification.studytitle: The sub-chronic effects of coffee on cognitive function in a healthy older population
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The sub-chronic effects of coffee on cognitive function in a healthy older population

interventions.interventions: Participants consume 3 servings of coffee per day for 3 months. Participants will be allocated to one of four types of instant coffee beverages (including one placebo beverage) with varying levels of caffeine in a between-subject, counter-balanced design. Each beverage is 3 g coffee mixed with boiling water and milk if desired.
interventions.comparator: Placebo drink (3 g maltodextrin with coffee flavour)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Speed of attention via reaction time performance on three computerised tasks: simple reaction time, choice reaction time and digit vigilance.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

primaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary memory via accuracy performance on four separate tasks: immediate word recall, delayed word recall, delayed word recognition and delayed picture recognition.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Accuracy of attention via accuracy performance on the choice reaction time task and digit vigilance task
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Memory consisting of a working memory factor score via accuracy on a spatial memory and numeric working memory computerised task and a speed of memory factor score via reaction time on delayed picture recognition, delayed word recognition, numeric working memory and spatial working memory tasks.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Speed of perceputal processing via inspection time on the Inspection Time Task
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Concentration and working memory via performance on the computerised serial sevens task
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Sustained attention via the Rapid Visual Information Processing task
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Stroop interference via the computerised Stroop Colour-Word Test to measure selective attention and cognitive flexibility
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Subjective mood via the Profile of Mood States
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Arterial blood flow via Doppler ultrasound measurements
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Endothelial function via arterial stiffness measurements
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Inflammation and oxidative stress via blood samples
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline, 1-month post coffee and 3-month post-coffee

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Aged 60 and over Medically and psychiatrically healthy Light to moderate coffee drinkers Ability to provide written informed consent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Currently taking psychotropic medications, existing psychiatric and neurological conditions, smoker, clinically high blood pressure, allergy to lactose, gluten or wheat

trial_design.concealment: The treatment was randomly assigned to the subject by a central randomisation stratification per gender, created off-site
trial_design.sequence: Randomization was a randomization stratification per gender provided as a list

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Brain Sciences Institute, Swinburne University of

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study is being conducted to see the sub-chronic effects of various coffee beverages on cognition, cardiovascular function and mood in healthy older adults. The study will compare the effect of different types of instant coffee beverages. Participants will consume one of four types of coffee beverages daily for 3 months. We will measure performance on different cognitive tasks, mood and cardiovascular measures before the consumption of the coffee beverage (baseline), 1-month after consumption of the coffee beverage and 3-months after consumption of the coffee beverage.
